lines.text: All of you! You all killed him! And my brother, and Riff. Not with bullets, or guns, with hate. Well now I can kill, too, because now I have hate!
I'd like to go back to San Juan.
I know a boat you can get on!
Why do you kids live like there's a war on?
I have no mind. I am the village idiot.

[sobbing bitterly]
Bernardo was right, If one of you was lying in the street bleeding, I'd walk by and spit on you.
You're not thinking I'm someone else?
I felt, I knew something never before was going to happen, had to happen. But this is so much more.
It's so much to believe. You're not making a joke?
I have not yet learned how to joke that way. I think now I never will.

[as they exit]
Say goodbye to the nice boys, Krupke.

[mimicking Shranke]
"You hoodlums don't own the streets."
"Keep off of the world!" A gang that don't own the street is nothin'!

[singing]
Play it cool boy, real cool.
My brother is a silly watchdog!
Ah, my sister is a precious jewel!
Boy, am I a victim of disappointment in you.
You heard - it's gonna be a fair fight!
And that's going to cure something?
From here on in, everythin's gonna be all right! I got a feelin'!
What have you been taking tonight?
A trip to the moon! And I'll tell ya a secret. It ain't a man that's up there, Doc. It's a girl, lady. Buenas noches, Senor.
Buenas noches? So that's why you made it a fair fight...
I'm gonna see her tomorrow an' I can't wait!

[after a pause]
No. I'm frightened enough for the both of us.
We gotta stand up to them Doc; it's important.
Fighting over a little piece of street is so important?
Why, when I was your age...
When *you* was my age? When my old man was my age, when my brother was my age... You was never my age, none of ya! And the sooner you creeps get hip to that, the sooner you'll dig us!
I'll dig you an early grave, that's what I'll dig.
Now I know Tony like I know me and I guarentee you can count him in
He'll be at the dance tonight at the gym
A-rab, I'm gonna make nice with him! I'm only gonna challenge him!
Look, Tony, I've never asked the time of day from a clock but I'm asking you, come to the dance tonight. I already told the gang you'd be there. If you don't show I'll be marked lousy.
Birth to Earth. And I'll live to regret this.
Who knows? Maybe what you've been waitin' on will be twitchin at the dance tonight.
Who knows? Could be... Who knows?
Four-and-a-half years I live wit' a buddy an' his family. I think I'm diggin' a guy's character... Boy, I'm a victim of disappointment in you.
End ya sufferin', little man. Why dontcha just pack up ya gear an' move out?

[singing]
When you're a Jet, you're a Jet all the way! from you first cigarette your last dyin' days.

[singing]
I like to be in America, OK by me in America, everything free in America...

[singing]
For a small fee in America!
I- I didn't believe hard enough.
Not here. They won't let us be.

[singing]
Hold my hand and we are halfway there, hold my hand and I'll take you there. Somehow! Someday! Some...
When do you kids stop? You make this world lousy!

[pretending to be a psychiatrist]
Juvenile delinquency is purely a social disease.
Hey! I got a social disease!
We've gotta show them who's on top!
Don't start up on me, or I'll punch in your stupid...

[singing]
Here come the Jets, like a bat out of hell - Someone gets in our way, someone don't feel so well.
You know what Maria and me are gonna do out in the country? We're gonna have kids, lots of 'em, and name them all after you-even the girls. That way when you come and visit...

[slaps him]
Wake up! Is this the only way to get to you? Fight like all you kids do?

[picks up the scattered money]
I told you how it happened, Maria understands, I thought you did too.

[after discovering that Bernardo is killed]
Make it not true, please make it not true!
Now move in and shake hands.
Well, that's the way it's done, buddy boy.
More gracious living. Everyone of you hates everyone of us, and we *hate* you right back.
Well end your suffering little man. Why don't you pack up your gear and clear out of here?
[the Jets dance across the streets of New York, eventually coming to a playground where they toss around a basketball. The ball is intercepted by Bernardo, leader of the Sharks]
[Bernardo drops the ball, Riff picks it up]
You have your big important council. The council,
[Tries to kiss her, she pulls away]
Ah, I'm an American girl now, I don't wait.
Ah, back home women know their place.
Back home little boys don't have war councils.
Ah, but they do here. You want me to be an American, don't you?

[singing]
I feel pretty, oh so pretty! I feel pretty, and witty, and gay!
If Chino hurts him, if he touches him, I swear to you I'll...
You'll do what Tony did to Bernardo?
Come in, come in! We won't bite you until we know you better.
I ain't never gonna get married. Too noisy.
You ain't never gonna get married. Too ugly.
Cracko Jacko! Down goes a teenage hoodlum.

[singing]
Everyone there will give big cheers!

[singing]
Everyone there will have moved here!
The first thing we do is we start showin' around like we have nothin' to hide...
Supposin' they ask us about the rumble?
Supposin' they ask you where's Tony and what party's lookin' for him? WITH A GUN.
I know I gotta go get a skirt.
We came with our hearts open!

[to Consuelo]
You came with your mouth open!

All right, wise guys. Now you listen to me. All of ya! You hoodlums don't own these streets. And I've had all the roughhouse I'm gonna put up with around here! You wanna kill each other, kill each other! But you ain't gonna do it on my beat. Are there any questions?
Yes sir. Would you mind translating that into Spanish?
Get your... friends outta here Bernardo. And stay out!
Boy oh boy! As if this neighborhood wasn't crummy enough!

Now look, fellas. Let's be reasonable. If I don't get a little law and order around here, I get busted down to a traffic corner. And your friend don't like traffic corners. So that means you're gonna start making nice with the PRs from now on.

I said nice, get it? Because if you don't, and I catch any of you doing any more brawlin' in my territory, I'm gonna personally beat the living crud out of each and every one of you and see that you go to the can and rot there. Say good-bye to the nice boys, Krupke.

[singing]
Everywhere grime in America / Organised crime in America / Terrible time in America
You Puerto Ricans get what you've been itching for, use of the playground, use of the gym, the streets, the candy store. So what if you do turn this whole town into a stinkin' pig sty?
[Bernado jumps up but the Jets stop him from attacking Schrank]
Don't stop him! He wants to get home, write a few letters to San Juan tell 'em how he's got it made over here! What I mean is... Clear out, you! I said, clear out!
[Bernardo and the Sharks move towards Schrank]
Yeah, sure, I know. It's a free country, I ain't got the right. But I got a badge. What do you got? Things are tough all over. Beat it.

[Bernardo and the Sharks leave, whistling]
My Country 'Tis of Thee...

[angrily]
I ain't playing anymore, CAN'T ANY OF YOU GET THAT?
You're a girl! be a girl and beat it!
But she wants to help get Tony!
At the gym last night, your brother got into a heavy argument because you danced with the wrong boy.
Cracko jacko. Down goes a teenage hoodlum.
Gee. Could a real zip gun make you do like that?
You don't know what a zip gun would do? Man, you better wear diapers.
Eh, go walk the streets like your sister.
Listen jailbait, I licked you twice and I can do it again!
What are we doin', poopin' around with dumb broads for?
Yeah, you. Didn't ya hear me?
Oh, yes sir. I got 20-20 hearing.

[not amused]
Then why didn't ya answer me?
His mother told him never to answer back to a cop.
You little wise apple! You want me to run you in?
Come on, Jets, round out! Not you, Anybodys, beat it.
Ah, Riff, you gotta let me in the gang! Didn't you just see me, I was smash, I'm a killer, I wanna fight!
How else's she gonna get a guy to touch her?
What are we doin', poopin' around with dumb broads for?
I and Velma ain't dumb! Are we, Velma?
I want you all the form two circles. The boys on the outside and the girls on the inside.
lines.character: Glad Hand, Social Worker Leading Dance

lines.text: Baby John, what are you doin' here?
What are you doin' nothin' here for? Come on.
I don't want the guys to see me A-Rab.
Did you get a look at their faces?
You know, at the rumble. Riff and Bernardo.
Yeah. I wish it was yesterday.
Well cut it out. You hear me? Cut it out!
A-Rab, what are we gonna do?
We're gonna meet with the other guys and form up. Thats what we're gonna do. Come on, lets go.
A-Rab, you got a hankerchief first?
We gotta show them who's on top! The Jets!
I'll dig you an early grave, that's what I'll dig.

[in the middle of the Officer Krupke song]
Hey, I've got a social disease!
